strings.sever_desc: Curse's victim takes damage over time
strings.bind_desc: Curse's victim is unable to move
strings.weaken_desc: Curse's victim takes double damage from attacks
strings.stagger_desc: Curse's victim recieves critical hits twice as often
strings.corrupt_desc: Curse's victim takes double damage from critical hits
strings.stun_desc: Curse's victim is unable to attack
strings.daze_desc: Curse's victim moves and attacks with reduced speed
strings.break_desc: Curse's victim loses defense over time
strings.can_be_used_to_learn_ability: Can be used to learn an ability: $1$
strings.can_be_used_to_learn_spell: Can be used to learn a spell: $1$
strings.proof_of_immigration_flavor: Owner of this document has immigrated from a foreign world
strings.captains_badge_flavor: Used to belong to Drenn Beknom
strings.credits:
Game by Aivaras Klimas a.k.a. Zuurix
Music by Bert Cole
strings.strike: User deals damage to an enemy in a melee range
strings.double_strike: User deals damage to an enemy in a melee range twice
strings.additional_crit_chance_x: Hits have additional $1$% critical hit chance
strings.break: Hit reduces defense based on weapon's accuracy
strings.heal_all: User heals all allies in a combat range
strings.heal_based: Amount healed is based on weapon's accuracy
strings.dive: User teleports to a melee range of the nearest enemy
strings.apply_bind_to_self_and_enemy: User applies the bind curse to self and the nearest enemy
strings.thunder: User deals $1$ damage to all enemies in a combat range
strings.blast: User deals damage to all enemies in a combat range
strings.might: User casts a spell that increases user's damage
strings.hammer_glyph: User casts a spell that doubles user's defense
strings.shoots_four_arrows: User shoots four arrows in quick succession
strings.shoots_arrow_bind: User shoots an arrow that applies the bind curse
strings.aura_steal_x: User steals $1$ aura from enemies in a melee range
strings.deals_x_damage: User deals $1$ damage to enemies in a melee range
strings.powerful_attack: Powerful attack: Deals five times more damage
strings.shock: User deals damage to all enemies in melee range
strings.thunder: User deals damage to all enemies in range
strings.iron_shards_flavor: One of the oldest combat spells.
strings.faction_line_3: You are not a member of any faction
strings.faction_line_4: You are wearing multiple faction items
strings.faction_line_7: You are recognized as a member of Locul faction
strings.faction_line_8: You are recognized as a member of Chaos faction
strings.x_is_ready_to_level_up: You have gained enough XP to level up $1$
strings.level_up: Level up! You have become a level $1$ $2$!
strings.sign_x%_archer_critical_hit_chance: $1$$2$% critical hit chance while using Archer weapons
strings.sign_x%_mage_curse_chance: $1$$2$% curse chance while using Mage weapons
strings.sign_x_mage_critical_hit_damage: $1$$2$ critical hit damage while using Mage weapons
strings.blast_limbs_off: I will blast your limbs off!
strings.no_demons_or_rogues: No demons or rogues in sight.
strings.drenn_low_health: I'll die with honor, fighting traitors of the crown!
strings.noru_diag_4: You show Noru the confirmation. Noru glances at it.
strings.noru_diag_6: Now I need your full name and origin world.
strings.noru_diag_7: You relay that information to Noru, he writes it down, then takes out a money pouch and hands it to you.
strings.noru_diag_9: I am also required to tell you about available jobs in the region.
strings.noru_diag_11: Hmm... LMC needs an ore grinder operator. Oh, never mind, I forgot to cross that out.
strings.noru_diag_12: I don't have anything else. You should talk to guard captain, Aden, he might have a quest for you.
strings.noru_diag_13: You can find him in the town's tavern.
strings.diag_quest_1_end_0: A realization strikes you. You have officially become a citizen of the Locked World.
strings.diag_quest_1_end_2: It was far from perfect, but you worked hard to create it and thinking about what you lost is almost insufferable.
strings.diag_quest_1_end_3: Despite that, you find yourself ready to work again.
strings.noru_diag_no_proof_1: Then come back when you have it.
strings.noru_diag_after_quest_1: Hello, how can I help you?
strings.ria_diag_0: It stopped. You saw visions of worlds, they were changing faster than you could realize what you were looking at. But it stopped.
strings.ria_diag_1: You look at the unfamiliar landscape.
strings.ria_diag_2: You are definitely not in Ocia. The sky is blue and there are no rings.
strings.ria_diag_4: Hi! I am Ria, are you alright?
strings.ria_diag_5: Uh... I don't know, am I?
strings.ria_diag_6: More or less. Welcome to Kayos, the Locked World!
strings.ria_diag_7: But I was supposed to be in Ocia.
strings.ria_diag_8: The World Gate you entered has malfunctioned and teleported you here, instead of a world it was linked to.
strings.ria_diag_9: It's called link interference, you are not the first to get here this way.
strings.ria_diag_10: So how do I get back to my world?
strings.ria_diag_11: I am very sorry, but you can't do anything. As I said, Kayos is the Locked World, there's no way to leave it and the only way to enter it is via interference.
strings.ria_diag_12: It takes you a few moments to process what Ria said. Suddenly you become overwhelmed with emotions: Shock, fear, confusion, disbelief.
strings.ria_diag_14: Ria waits until you calm down. With some effort, you bottle up the emotions. Now it's not time to panic.
strings.ria_diag_15: If it makes you feel any better, you'll get compensation and will be able to start a new life here. There is a program for immigrants like you.
strings.ria_diag_17: Ria gives you a small paper card.
strings.ria_diag_18: This is your proof of immigration. Don't lose it.
strings.ria_diag_20: Now you need to reach the town of Locul. The path to it is dangerous, so I'll give you a weapon and healing kits.
strings.ria_diag_21: I don't understand, dangerous in what way?
strings.ria_diag_22: It goes through a territory controlled by rogues. They are criminals of all kinds.
strings.ria_diag_23: If you encounter anyone on your way to the town, don't speak with them, and if they attack you, well, that's why you need a weapon.
strings.ria_diag_24: What weapon you are most familiar with? I've got a few swords, staves, and a bow with arrows.
strings.ria_diag_27: Ria hands you a sword and three healing kits.
strings.ria_diag_30: Just doing my job. When you get to the town, take the immigration proof to Noru. He is in a building with the WELCOME sign.
strings.ria_diag_31: And... Kayos is not great at making good first impressions, but trust me, it's a fine world to live in. I hope you will find your place here. Now go.
strings.regretful_rogue_diag_3: I don't want to, so I won't unless you make me.
strings.regretful_rogue_diag_4: Thank you. I know you are an immigrant, so I want you to know that despite what you've probably been told, not all rogues are murderous maniacs.
strings.regretful_rogue_diag_11: It will help in case you get attacked by one of the bad rogues. Don't thank me, just be kind to the good ones. Okay?
strings.regretful_rogue_diag_15: I'm not going to promise you anything.
strings.regretful_rogue_diag_16: Rogue frowns, shrugs, and ends the conversation.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_0: Oh, hi, stranger. New to this world?
strings.rogue_historian_diag_2: Hey, don't look at me like that. I'm not a murderer.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_4: Oh, yeah. Why else I would be here?
strings.rogue_historian_diag_8: Usually by committing very serious crimes. Again with that look. My crime was merely writing a book.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_9: I was a historian and people didn't like what I wrote, to put it lightly. You see, I think monarchy was good for Kayos.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_10: Councils and elections are great, sure, but, damn, when a king decides to get something done, it happens.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_11: I expressed such views in my book, so I was called a monarchist and made a rogue.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_12: There is a spell that creates this irremovable glowing mark. The guards attack rogues on sight, that's why I am here, living in the desert.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_14: It is. The city councils keep talking about building prisons, making punishments reversible and more humane, but nothing has been done for years.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_16: That's what happens when the monarchy isn't in charge.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_17: He says, almost mockingly. He seems regretful.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_18: What happened? To the monarchy, I mean?
strings.rogue_historian_diag_19: The rebellion happened. Talyann the Third wasn't a good king and war broke out.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_20: It lasted seven bloody years and ended with monarchy losing.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_21: At the end of the war, Talyann the Fourth blew up half of what was the Kingdom of Azu'urunn.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_22: Half of the inhabited lands, basically. Three cities were in the range of the King's Spell, hundreds of thousands died.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_23: Five years later, my book was released, and, well, you know what happened.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_24: I'm starting to understand why you were made a rogue.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_26: Historian says sarcastically and shakes his head.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_27: I should have waited before writing that damn book.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_28: Nowadays I could get away with just becoming a widely unliked person. It was a bit early to express that kind of opinion.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_29: There is another thing that I regret. I wrote that this whole rogue thing was a good way to deal with criminals.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_30: I don't think that anymore. I have to admit, not everything monarchy did was good. Rebels had a point.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_33: Oh, well. Go now, leave the old fool with his throughs.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_35: Well, I'd talk with you, but I don't want to be here longer than I have to.
strings.rogue_historian_diag_36: Disappointment appears on the old man's face, but he nods.
strings.diag_helpful_rogue_2: You look troubled, what's the problem?
strings.diag_helpful_rogue_3: Oh, it's nothing, I'm just trying to get to Locul.
strings.diag_helpful_rogue_4: I can help you with that, I know a shortcut.
strings.diag_helpful_rogue_8: Thank you, but I don't think I need help.
strings.diag_helpful_rogue_10: Well, okay. Show me the way.
strings.ria_quest_started_0: You need to get to the town, it's not safe here.
strings.ria_after_quest_1: Not really, I have some problems at the moment. But I'll be alright.
strings.ria_after_quest_3: Yeah, I'm alright. Thanks for your help.
strings.ria_after_quest_4: Don't mention it. Good luck to you.
strings.diag_kayos_intro_0: You stop for a moment to catch your breath.
strings.diag_kayos_intro_1: When you are no longer focused on moving, your senses capture hundreds of things you haven't got used to yet.
strings.diag_kayos_intro_2: The warm wind. A giant sun in the sky that didn't move since you got here. Sounds of people shouting in the distance.
strings.diag_kayos_intro_3: A smell of smoke, iron, and hot stone. A taste of dust. A view of pits, rocks, and broken equipment.
strings.diag_kayos_intro_5: You say quietly, just to hear how it sounds again. It's the first time you used this word. You know that it's not the last.
strings.diag_kayos_intro_6: A strange feeling overtakes you, a mix of hope and anxiety. A bit of hope and lots of anxiety.
strings.diag_kayos_intro_7: Your thoughts are interrupted when you hear shouting again. It's closer this time. You have to move.
strings.diag_45: Hi, I'm looking for something to do.
strings.diag_48: That's what everyone is calling me.
strings.diag_49: Got it. Can you fight? I got a bit of a rogue problem.
strings.diag_51: Here in Kayos, we don't put our criminals in the prisons, like in more civilized worlds.
strings.diag_53: We mark them with magic and then try to keep them away from settlements.
strings.diag_54: We call them rogues. Most of them continue being a threat to civilians.
strings.diag_57: Well, it's not hard to keep them away from this town, rogues in the desert aren't well equipped. At least for now. That brings me to my problem.
strings.diag_58: You see, before me, the guard captain was Drenn Beknom.
strings.diag_59: He is a monarchist and Lord Atan's ally. He wanted to take over Locul and turn it into Lord Atan's outpost to attack Eastern Trilith.
strings.diag_60: I'm sorry, but that does not mean anything to me.
strings.diag_61: What you need to know is that we overthrew our king twenty years ago after a long war.
strings.diag_62: There are still people who want tyranny back, most notable of them is Lord Atan. He's trying to crown himself and restore the monarchy.
strings.diag_63: Drenn wants to help Atan. Drenn was probably from the minority of people who had a good life during the reign and lost that during the war.
strings.diag_65: Long story short, I found out about his plans, now he's a rogue hiding in the desert and I have become a captain.
strings.diag_66: I'm worried that Drenn have not abandoned his plans. I have reports of rogues becoming more organized.
strings.diag_67: A weapon merchant was attacked a few days ago. A crate of swords and arrow launcher parts was taken.
strings.diag_68: I think Drenn is behind this.
strings.diag_69: Here's the deal: You kill Drenn for me, bring me his captain's badge, and I reward you with a thousand gold.
strings.diag_84: So that's what kind of world it is? I'm not a pacifist, but I'm also not a bounty hunter. I don't think I can do it.
strings.diag_85: Oh, you can. And you should. If you won't stop Drenn, innocent people might die.
strings.diag_86: And yeah, that's what kind of world Kayos is. But you can help make it better. Preserve what's left of civilization after centuries of regime.
strings.diag_87: %A monarch does not feed those who disobey.%
strings.diag_89: That was the official policy of the monarchy for two hundred years. But kings and queens are no more. Things are going to change.
strings.diag_90: The prisons will be built, the guilty will be properly judged and punished, Kayos will become a safer world.
strings.diag_91: Armed guards and bounty hunters won't be needed anymore.
strings.diag_71: We just have to survive until then.
strings.diag_74: Yeah, do that. As I said, bring me his badge, and I'll reward you.
strings.diag_78: I told you got what it takes. Don't think about it too much, sometimes you got to spill the blood to protect the civilization.
strings.diag_100: You are right, but I don't know if it should be me who does that. Maybe-... No. I can't think about this right now.
strings.diag_101: Just know that Kayos needs fighters and defenders. Take your gold, you really earned it.
strings.diag_80: Well, that's it I guess. I got no more quests for you at the moment.
strings.diag_81: Alright, bye for now. I'll go spend that gold.
strings.diag_99: Hey, about that job I gave you. Don't worry about it, someone else has killed him
strings.diag_104: Got no quests for you at the moment. Come back later.
strings.diag_106: Hello! How can I help you? Need coffee? Food? Or want to report a crime?
strings.diag_114: Legate Vaska refuses to trade with you. Your Locul reputation is too low.
strings.select_quest: Select quest to see log here.
strings.quest_not_started_1: Speak with Ria in Moonrise Desert to start this quest.
strings.quest_completed_1:
I have successfully reached Locul and received compensation from Noru.
Quest completed.

Reward:
120 Survivor XP
250 gold
strings.quest_1_stage_0:
Something called link interference happened to the World Gate I entered and I was taken to Kayos, the Locked World.

I was told to go to a building with the WELCOME sign that is in the town of Locul and talk to Noru.
strings.quest_1_stage_1:
Something called link interference happened to the World Gate I entered and I was taken to Kayos, the Locked World.

I have successfully reached Locul and received compensation from Noru.
strings.quest_not_started_2:
To start this quest:
1. Complete When Luck Runs Out quest.
2. Speak with guard captain Aden in Locul.
strings.quest_failed_2:
Someone else has killed Drenn.
Quest failed.
strings.quest_completed_2:
I have killed the rogue captain and claimed my reward.
Quest completed.

Reward:
1000 gold
100 Locul reputation
strings.quest_2_stage_0:
A rogue captain Drenn Beknom is a threat to Locul. If I kill him and bring his badge to Aden, I will be rewarded with a thousand gold.

Aden told me that Beknom is in the desert, south of the town.
strings.ventin_note: Ventin owes me 50 silver. And a favor.
strings.seal_charm_note: Pick up seal charms from Ocia. Northern Gate City, Lantern street 5.
strings.demo_message: This a demo version: Press B to find out how to get access to the full version
